00040 #ifndef _uimanager_h
00041 #define _uimanager_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 #include "managerbase.h"
00046 #include "vector2.h"
00047 
00048 #include <map>
00049 
00050 namespace Gorilla
00051 {
00052     class Silverback;
00053     class Layer;
00054     class Screen;
00055 }
00056 
00057 namespace phys
00058 {
00059     class UIScreen;
00060     class UILayer;
00061     class InputQueryTool;
00062     namespace UI
00063     {
00064         class Button;
00065         class Widget;
00066         class Scrollbar;
00067     }
00068     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00069     /// @class UIManager
00070     /// @headerfile uimanager.h
00071     /// @brief This class is responsible for any and all user interactions with the User interface/HUD.
00072     /// @details Currently, you have to create the UI/HUD in code.  Font and sprite data is loaded through a premade Gorilla file(*.gorilla).
00073     ///////////////////////////////////////
00074     class PHYS_LIB UIManager : public ManagerBase
00075     {
00076         protected:
00077             /// @brief Pointer for the Gorilla core class, where this manager gets it's functionality.
00078             Gorilla::Silverback* Silver;
00079             std::vector< UIScreen* > Screens;
00080             UI::Button* HoveredButton;
00081             UI::Widget* HoveredWidget;
00082             UI::Widget* WidgetFocus;
00083             InputQueryTool* InputQueryer;
00084             void HoverChecks();
00085             void WidgetFocusUpdate();
00086         public:
00087             /// @brief Class Constructor.
00088             /// @details Standard class initialization constructor.
00089             UIManager();
00090             /// @brief Class Destructor.
00091             /// @details The class destructor.
00092             ~UIManager();
00093             /// @brief Inherited from ManagerBase.
00094             void Initialize();
00095             /// @brief Inherited from ManagerBase.
00096             void DoMainLoopItems();
00097             /// @brief Loads a Gorilla file for use with this manager.
00098             /// @param Name The name of the file to be loaded, not including the extension.
00099             void LoadGorilla(const String& Name);
00100             /// @brief Gets the button the mouse is hovering over.
00101             /// @details This check will look through both standalone buttons and widget buttons.
00102             /// @return Returns a pointer to the button, or NULL if it's not over any visable buttons.
00103             UI::Button* GetHoveredButton();
00104             /// @brief Gets the Widget the mouse is hovering over.
00105             /// @details If the widget found during widget checks belongs to a widget, this will get that widget.
00106             /// @return Returns a pointer to the widget, or NULL if it's not over any visable buttons.
00107             UI::Widget* GetHoveredWidget();
00108             /// @brief Gets the current widget being controlled.
00109             /// @details The widget control is used mostly for manipulating widgets while the mouse is not
00110             /// currently hovering over them, such as the click and drag action of scrollbars and resizing windows.
00111             /// @return Returns a pointer to the currently controlled widget, or NULL if none are being controlled this frame.
00112             UI::Widget* GetWidgetFocus();
00113             /// @brief Creates an internal HUD screen.
00114             /// @details Screens are the base set of renderable UI you can use, allowing you to switch entire sets of UI's
00115             /// on the fly if needed.  For performance reasons you should always keep the number of screens you create to a minimum.
00116             /// @param Screen The name to be given to the screen.
00117             /// @param Atlas The name of a previously loaded Gorilla file to be used with this screen.
00118             /// @param Viewport The name of the viewport to create this screen in.
00119             UIScreen* CreateScreen(const String& Screen, const String& Atlas, const String& Viewport="DefaultViewport");
00120             /// @brief Gets an already created screen by name.
00121             /// @return Returns a pointer to the screen of the specified name.
00122             UIScreen* GetScreen(const String& Name);
00123             /// @brief Gets an already created screen by index.
00124             /// @return Returns a pointer to the screen at the specified index.
00125             UIScreen* GetScreen(Whole Index);
00126             /// @brief Gets the number of screens created and stored in this manager.
00127             /// @return Returns the number of screens this manager is storing.
00128             Whole GetNumScreens();
00129             /// @brief Deletes a screen and removes all trace of it from the manager.
00130             /// @details Destroying a screen will also destroy all of it's layers, and everything contained in those layers.
00131             /// @param Screen The screen to be destroyed.
00132             void DestroyScreen(UIScreen* Screen);
00133             /// @brief Deletes all screens stored in this manager.
00134             void DestroyAllScreens();
00135             /// @brief Searches all screens and gets the named Layer.
00136             /// @return Returns the named layer if found, NULL if not.
00137             UILayer* GetLayer(String& Name);
00138             /// @brief Searches all visable screens and layers to see if a button was clicked.
00139             /// @details This is called automatically once every frame.  Should only be called on manually if
00140             /// you need more then one check per frame.
00141             /// @return Returns the button clicked if there is one, NULL if not.
00142             UI::Button* CheckButtonMouseIsOver();
00143             /// @brief Searches all visable screens and layers to see if a widget was clicked.
00144             /// @details This is called automatically once every frame.  Should only be called on manually if
00145             /// you need more then one check per frame.
00146             /// @return Returns the widget clicked if there is one, NULL if not.
00147             UI::Widget* CheckWidgetMouseIsOver();
00148             /// @brief Checks to see if the mouse is over a UI element.
00149             /// @details This should only be called on after this manager does it's main loop items for best results.
00150             /// @return Returns true if the mouse is over a visable UI element, false if not.
00151             bool MouseIsInUISystem();
00152             /// @brief Gets the current window dimensions.
00153             /// @return Returns a Vector2 representing the current window dimensions.
00154             Vector2 GetWindowDimensions();
00155             /// @brief Gets the input queryer used for automation in this subsystem.
00156             /// @return Returns a pointer to the InputQueryTool used to query input events for this subsystem.
00157             InputQueryTool* GetInputQueryer();
00158             /// @brief Gets the type of manager that this manager is.
00159             /// @return Returns an enum value representing the type of manager that this manager is.
00160             ManagerBase::ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00161             /// @internal
00162             /// @brief Gets the internal silverback pointer.
00163             /// @return Returns a pointer to the internal silverback class.
00164             Gorilla::Silverback* GetSilverbackPointer();
00165     };//uimanager
00166 }//phys
00167 
00168 #endif
